body.p: Born in Floydsburg, Kentucky on July 25, 1824. His family moved to Illinois in 1832. He enlisted as 1st Lieutenant in the 4th Illinois Infantry on June 13, 1846 as a part of the Mexican-American war. Attended Louisville Law School in 1848. Moved to California in 1849 as a part of the California Gold Rush. Returned to Illinois in 1851. Oglesby became an early member of the Republican Party. He lost an election for the US Congress, but was elected to the Illinois State Senate in 1860. Commissioned Colonel of the 8th Illinois Infantry April 25, 1861. Oglesby was nicknamed "Uncle Dick." Promoted to Brigadier General on March 21, 1862 with the Army of the Tennessee. Promoted to Major General on November 29, 1862. After the war's conclusion, Oglesby became the governor of Illinois on January 16, 1865. Oglesby was present in the room when Abraham Lincoln died on April 15, 1865. Richard Oglesby died on April 24, 1899.
